content.html:
Cool Down (5 minutes)

Student-Facing Statement

Which graph correctly shows the solution to the inequality \( \dfrac{7x-3}9 \geq 8-2x \)? Show or explain your reasoning.

A

B

C

D


Student Response

Graph C. Compare your answer:

  • I tested 2, 3, and 4 for the values of \(x\), and 3 and 4 make the inequality true.
  • I solved a related equation and then tested a couple of values on either side of the solution.

Response to Student Thinking

More Chances 

Students will have more opportunities to understand the mathematical ideas in this cool-down, so there is no need to slow down or add additional work to the next lessons. Instead, use the results of this cool-down to provide guidance for what to look for and emphasize over the next several lessons to support students in advancing their current understanding.

A later activity offers another opportunity to discuss determining if a solution set is greater than or less than a boundary value.
